title: Everett arson suspect arrested in Alabama
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Crime Lawrence Stockton allegedly started a fire at an Everett apartment building that displaced residents and caused extensive damage.
Earlier this month, a fire at an apartment complex in Everett displaced dozens of residents and caused hundreds of thousands of dollars in damage.
Authorities quickly determined that the fire was suspicious and began investigating.

title: A New England city just ranked among 10 trending travel destinations worldwide in 2026
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Travel A hint: It's acclaimed for its pizza.
New Haven skyline.

Adobe Stock By Kristi Palma October 21, 2025 | 12:03 PM 1 minute to read New Englanders can experience one of the planet’s trendiest travel destinations next year without traveling very far, according to Skyscanner.

title: Police make arrest after former Fall River mayor stabbed, seriously injured
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Will Flanagan was rushed to a local hospital Monday with significant injuries, Fall River police said.
Former Fall River Mayor William Flanagan in 2010.

Debee Tlumacki for the Boston Globe, File By Abby Patkin October 21, 2025 | 11:55 AM 1 minute to read Fall River police have arrested a person of interest accused of seriously injuring the city’s former mayor, Will Flanagan, in a Monday evening stabbing.

title: ‘That’s the way he plays the game’: Ty Law defended Drake Maye after injury scare
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Morning Sports Update "That's why we love Drake Maye.
" Drake Maye following the Patriots' win over the Titans.

AP Photo/John Amis By Hayden Bird October 21, 2025 | 10:51 AM 2 minutes to read Ty Law’s take on Drake Maye: As the Patriots have rolled to a four-game winning streak in recent weeks, praise of quarterback Drake Maye has grown with each successive victory.

title: The best breweries in Massachusetts
author: Erika Adams
bullets: Beer Find the best breweries in Massachusetts — including reader favorites and a statewide map to guide your next beer tour.

Gene Buonaccorsi By Erika Adams October 21, 2025 | 9:49 AM 3 minutes to read Alongside the lobster rolls, the clam chowder, and the steak tips, a cold, crisp beer is a culinary cornerstone of Massachusetts.
And, since this is New England, that means hazy, juicy New England IPAs are the name of the game for many breweries in the area.

title: Coach who ended Celtics’ 2024-25 season paid Boston a visit during practice
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Celtics "To have Thibs here at our practice and explaining some of things that he saw that helped them beat us only helps me get better, only helps us get better.
" Tom Thibodeau was fired by the Knicks after the 2024-25 season.
Danielle Parhizkaran/The Boston Globe The Celtics had an interesting visitor on site for Monday’s practice at the Auerbach Center: former Knicks head coach Tom Thibodeau.

title: NFL insider lists several ‘long-term’ targets for Patriots at trade deadline
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "My understanding is their approach is going to be to take a long-term view of this whole thing.
" Jordan Addison has been a dynamic wideout for the Vikings.
AP Photo/Ellen Schmidt The 5-2 New England Patriots are presumably well ahead of schedule in their ongoing rebuilding process.

title: Arlington man arrested, allegedly punched 77-year-old ‘No Kings’ protester in the face in Hyannis
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Local News Peter Afouxenides, 61, pleaded not guilty in Barnstable District Court on Monday to one charge of assault and battery on a person 60 years or older/disabled person.
Jeffrey Smith holds up his sign at home prior to the "No Kings" protest in Hyannis Saturday.
At right, he is at the hospital after he was attacked while leaving the protest.

title: Julian Edelman explains why Patriots will win AFC East
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "Winning games you’re supposed to win, especially when there’s a ton of praise all week, is the mark of a well coached team.
" Julian Edelman believes the Patriots will win the AFC East this year.
AP Photo/Steven Senne The Patriots leapfrogged the Bills and moved into first place in the AFC East last week after Buffalo lost to the Falcons on Monday Night Football.
